lead_paragraph: Harco Construction, vowing to appeal, said it would not obey a judge’s order that it pay for public service announcements on worker safety.

headline.print_headline: Construction Firm Found Guilty in ’15 Death of Queens Worker Defies Sentence
headline.main: Construction Firm Found Guilty in Queens Worker’s Death Defies Sentence

snippet: Harco Construction, vowing to appeal, said it would not obey a judge’s order that it pay for public service announcements on worker safety....
abstract: Harco Construction, which was found guilty of manslaughter in 2015 death of construction worker Carlos Moncayo at Manhattan site, says it will not comply with judge's order to pay for public service announcements on worker safety; company's lawyer says campaign would be admission of wrongdoing and would cost hundreds of thousands of dollars.
